text: Kelly Sawyer Patricof is a Canadian-American businesswoman. She was named as one of Time's 100 Most Influential People of 2024. == Works == She is the Co- CEO of the nonprofit Baby2Baby. Baby2Baby has given over 22 million diapers and other essentials to low-income families. FEMA reached out to the nonprofit for help during the COVID-19 pandemic. Baby2Baby can create diapers for 80% less than the retail price. They were recognized as the "most innovative nonprofit in the world" by Fast Company. Patricof and California Governor Gavin Newsom led a policy change of no more taxes on diapers in California. Patricof and her co-founder, Kelly Weinstein, host a yearly party. It has raised millions for their non-profit. == Profits == She additionally made the Create & Cultivate 100. She's been profiled by CNBC, Forbes, LaLigne, and Rent the Runway, and the book 100 Making a Difference. She was a speaker at the 30/50 Summit. She is the creative director of Satine Boutique. She is also a children's book author. She co-wrote the children's book A Bear to Share. Patricof was a model in Vancouver, Canada. She lives with her husband and two children in Los Angeles, California. == References == Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Canadian businesspeople Category:American businesspeople Category:Canadian philanthropists Category:American philanthropists
title: Kelly Sawyer Patricof
